intro: Rumicastrum holtumii, commonly known as the Holtum's spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Its botanical features make it a resilient plant suitable for xeriscaping and desert landscaping.
